triples.name: Schema (psychology)
triples.relevance: Core framework for understanding how individuals organize information about the world and process new stimuli

triples.name: Memory
triples.relevance: Fundamental mechanism underlying schema-based information processing and recall of perceptual experiences

triples.name: Recall (memory)
triples.relevance: Primary task studied to understand how schemas facilitate or structure the retrieval of stored information

triples.name: Information processing (psychology)
triples.relevance: Theoretical framework describing how individuals encode, store, and retrieve information when confronted with stimulus configurations

triples.name: Frederic Bartlett
triples.relevance: Pioneering psychologist who first used schema theory in 1932 to explain how people structure and recall perceptual experience
